thread.title: Vote for the best haunted house around Portland (poll): Halloween 2015
thread.title_full: Vote for the best haunted house around Portland (poll): Halloween 2015 | OregonLive.com

author: Jamie Hale | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Vote for the best haunted house around Portland (poll): Halloween 2015
text:
Halloween is nearly upon us, and as always, it's time to face your worst fears. Where better to do it than at one of the Portland area's creative and horrifying haunted houses – from the "full contact terror" in Gresham to the old grain elevator out past Newberg.
Last year we held our first reader poll to determine the best haunted house around the area, a contest won by the always-hyped Fright Town in Portland. This year we're putting them all back up to a vote, but since Fright Town so completely dominated the competition last year, I'm removing it from the poll for 2015.
No offense, Fright Town , you're just too popular to compete here.
The rest of the candidates are below. Choose wisely, and may the best haunted house win!
The Candidates
Milburn's Haunted Manor – Located just outside Hubbard, the old Milburn Manor Hotel is supposedly the scene of a grizzly unsolved murder...
Carlton Haunted Granary – The Madsen Grain Elevator out in Carlton is transformed into a haunted house. Little to no details are offered online, making it all the scarier. (Read a 2013 Oregonian review .)
The Fear PDX – The Fear has moved from Vancouver to a location near the PDX airport, where you can pick from five attractions: Blood Moon, Factory of the Undead, Festival of Freaks, The Condemned and The Harvest.
Fear Asylum – Run by the Milwaukie Elks Club, the haunted asylum focuses on exposing you to your worst fears, whatever they may be. Special "lights out hours" on Oct. 11, 18 and 25 give you only a glow stick to navigate the horrors.
13 th Door – A winding maze of horrors, the Beaverton haunted house sets up a host of diverse and detailed sets.
House of Shadows – The Gresham haunted house is billed as a "full contact terror experience," meaning the actors can, and will, physically harass you. It offers three haunts this year: Sinister Circus, Purgatory and Hooch.
--Jamie Hale | jhale@oregonian.com | @HaleJamesB
